posts.name: Kevin
posts.cooked:
For some reason MKCad just died on me today. Whenever I open it, the menu flashes for a bit, then it turns white and “Invalid Authorization Code” pops up. I’ve tried reinstalling it, allowing popups, allowing cookie access, etc. I’m also using Chrome if that helps and all privacy chrome extensions are turned off. Does anyone know why this is happening? image 1650×788 102 KB

image 1650×788 102 KB

image 1650×788 102 KB

posts.cooked: I remember some members of our team had similar issues when using browsers like Safari. Were you maybe using a different browser than normal?

I still haven’t resolved this issue. It occasionally works and sometimes doesn’t work, I have no idea why.

Also I’ve tried using different browsers before and it doesn’t work.

posts.name: Andrew Beck
posts.cooked: I’m getting this error too. Has anyone been able to resolve it?

posts.name: Kevin
posts.cooked: Update: Can someone please figure out what is going on? I cannot CAD. I am dying.

posts.name: Phil Szymanowski
posts.cooked: Just insert the parts the standard way for the time being. I will see if I can get someone on it.

posts.name: Kevin
posts.cooked:
I believe i have found a (rather janky) solution to this problem.

Go to chrome://flags/, enable the “override software rendering list” setting, and relaunch the browser. Keep alternating enabling/disabling the setting and relaunching Chrome until it works. After each relaunch go to MKCad Library to check if it worked.

Do i know how it works? no. Did it work? yes (for two seperate devices)
